title: Matchmaking
body: Given the recent plummet in player numbers, surely it is about time Oceania consider adjusting their matchmaking algorithms to favour balanced matchmaking over queue times in ranked - particularly in platinum and lower where large populations of players still exist.

I;m not sure how that's particularly unbalanced. It's low plats into high golds, and everyone on the Blue team has a real high winrate (pushing their MMR up) while Red has rther average winrates (meaning their MMR has either plateaued or dropped).

MMR found on sites like op.gg is at best a guideline. It's far from accurate. Riot's calculations are hidden, and intentionally so to prevent people abusing them.

And if new accounts start around Silver, wouldn't it be more important to have the matchmaking give more balanced matchups, since that is where the majority of actual NEW players would start, and you wouldn't want to alienate them from playing the game because they're not getting anything out of being hard stomped every game?

The Silver point was that you *can't* always accurately balance in Silver because of those new accounts. If a fresh account starts ranked and wins 5 games in a row, they could be high Gold skill or they could be Challenger (whether they are smurfs or not), or they could even just be getting lucky. There's no way to distinguish from such a small sample size of games, so things are always going to be a little wacky until those new accounts start to settle into their proper ranks.
